moves.4... Qc7: I protect the knight with my queen to keep him from messing with my pawn structure
moves.5. O-O: his King is safely tucked away now
moves.5... g6: I plan to put the bishop on g7 and then castle
moves.6. d4: he tries to take control of the center...
moves.7... dxc6: I probably should have used the b-pawn
moves.10. Re1: he lines the rook up with my King, no doubt planning to follow with e5
moves.12. Ng3: his knight moves, but still has no good squares available
moves.13. Nce2: now I'm confused... he itentionally moves both knights to squares where they are "stuck"
moves.13... Rad8: I plot a discovered attack on his Queen
moves.15. f5: he must not be paying attention!
moves.16. Rxd1: the rook was an acceptable loss
moves.17. Kf1: he moves away from the corner
moves.18. h3: he tries to drive away the bishop..
moves.18... Bxe2+: so I take the knight/bishop trade
moves.19... Nxe4: I pick off a free pawn and plan Ng3 next to pick off the pinned knight
moves.20. Ke1: he breaks the pin, ruining my plan
moves.22. g3: he saw where I was headed (h4)
moves.22... Qc5: c5 will work just as well
moves.24. Bd2: protecting the pawn and linking the rooks
